The Lyra Program - KSPs Constellation

After the 2 Failed MRs, I am finally going to plan to actually do one Successfully, This Takes Inspirations from @borisperrons, @Jay The Amazing Toaster, @Clamp-o-Trons Constellation Program Saves, I am going to be Following the Constellation Program Architecture and might try a Few Other Proposed Missions (Skylab II, DST, Mars Base Camp, ARM) etc etc, Main Mods are - KSRSS, Restock, Restock+, TweakScale, HumanStuff, KerbalRenamer and Tundra Exploration.

Edited December 11, 2020 by JakGamingKSP

Prologue

After Years of the Space Shuttle, The Lyra Program is Announced to Send Humans to the Moon and Mars, Utilizing 2 Launch Vehicles, The Athena 1 and Athena V

The HLV, Athena V Uses 5 Mainsail Engines alongside 2 SRBs on the Side for the First Stage, The Second Stage (EDS) Uses 1 UR-2x Engine for EOI and TLI.

The Athena I uses a Single SRB for its First Stage and A U2x for the Second Stage, It carries the Crux Crew Capsule into LEO for ISS Missions or Pegasus Missions

The First Crew for Crux-CDM has been Named however, The Commander is Ralph Cook, Pilot is Henry Ross, Due to the Fact Crux-CDM is a Test Flight it will only have 2 Crew Members of the 3 that it can Fit

Crew Picture

Chapter 1 - Testing 123

As the Athena I-X Launch Vehicle stands on LC-39B, The SRB is shown partially, In 6 Hours, This is where History will be made and thrive

The Mission was VERY Uneventful with the fact that the Only Operational stage was the SRB.

 

haha les go brrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr

Next was the Athena I-Y Mission which will test the LES in a Max-Q Situation

Athena I-Y is an IFAT Mission, Next Mission after this will be EFT-1 then Crux 1

LES go brrrrrrrrr

 

Thats the end for Chapter 1!

Chapter 2 - Crux Soars and Athena V gets Tested.

At Stennis, Tests begin on Athena V Hardware

If all goes to plan, The Athena V-X Prototype should launch in 2016 with a Full Athena V Launching in 2018

EFT-1 Lifts off the Pad, EFT-1 wont dock with the ISS, Instead testing out the U-2x Engine and the Orion Systems

EFT-1's Landing was Celebrated, Next Mission Afterwards will be Crux-CDM with Crux-1 Launching 1 Month Afterwards

Meanwhile at Wallops Flight Facility, Testing for an Unknown Mission Begins

Spoiler

This Mission will Replace InSight and will be done around 2018.

The Crew for Crux-1 has been Announced after EFT-1

  • Commander Lee Banks
  • Pilot Cindy Carpenter
  • Mission Specialist Ronnie Moreno

Lee Banks Flew on STS-117, STS-125, STS-133

Cindy Carpenter Flew on STS-132

Ronnie Moreno Flew on STS-135, Soyuz TMA-08m

Crux 2 Crew has also been Announced

  • Commander Anne Frazier - STS-135, Soyuz TMA-07m
  • Pilot Rodney Reed - STS-131
  • Mission Specialist Vadim Papanov - Soyuz TMA-04m
Edited October 17, 2020 by JakGamingKSP

The Daily Show - January 4th 2015

NASA Has announced a Mars Sample-Return Mission, The Hermes Mission is to be done in 2 Launches, The MLAV (Mars Lander and Ascent Vehicle) is due to be launched in 2019 and one week Later the ERO Will Launch (Earth Return Orbiter)

The MLAV will be Launched on a Athena V while the ERO on a Ghidorah Heavy, This Mission will return the first Real Martian Soil as the Only way we have Observed Mars's Surface here is through Martian Meteorites and Probes. A Verification of the System will be test during the MOPSAR (MOon Pole SAmple Return) Mission in 2016 which will Launch on the Muo V 541, The Next Planned NASA Launch is Crux-CDM which will be in 2 Months. In other NASA News, The Launch Date of the Demeter Orbiter has its Launch Date Confirmed, It will be Launching on December 12th 2015 on the Muo V 541.

This is Jeffery Long and Thank you for Reading the NASA Segment of The Daily Show.

Chapter 3 - Candidates and Demos

May I Welcome you, NASA Astronaut Group 21 "Skylanders"

As The 10 New Astronauts walked onto the Stage, Applause was everywhere, These Astronauts knew that They Will walk on the Moon.

The Youngest was Henry Harris who was 25 and the Oldest was Ralph Evans who was 38.

The Full Astronaut List was

Henry Harris 

Craig Chapman

Leslie Rose

Ralph Evans

Marie Caldwell

Patrick Gilbert

Lisa Horton

Fred Hanson

Craig Fletcher

Pamela Burton

 

The Next Major Event After this was Crux-CDM

Liftoff of Crux-CDM, Beginning The Crewed Journey to the Stars

ISS and Crux-CDM, Crux-CDM will stay for 2 Weeks docked to the KSS to Look at Life Support Systems and General Systems

Crux-CDM Undocking

De-orbit Burn

This is a Short Chapter but it will Get Longer

Chapter 4 - Koryol and Athena V

With Russia wanting to put a man on the Moon, They Announce the Koryol Capsule, Which is the due Soyuz Replacement. However Most information is withheld.

Next Event was Crux-1 which will be Carrying the crew of Expedition 45/46.

After this, Planning Begins for a New American Resupply Launch Vehicle, Codenamed "Service", It will utilize the Launch of an Ares 1 Cargo to Launch it to the ISS

Soyuz TMA-18M Undocking from the ISS

This was the last known Transmission of Soyuz TMA-18M, The Soyuz Capsule's Parachute detached leading the Cosmonauts to Smash into the Ground at 181m/s, The Astronauts Killed in this Incident was

  • Commander Pyotr Nesterov - Flew on Soyuz TMA-19 as Flight Engineer
  • Flight Engineer Emilla Eybozhenka - Maiden Flight as Pilot
  • Flight Engineer Makar Abramov - First Flight, Graduated top of 2010 Class

Soyuz Flights have been put on hold until the Cause of Crash is determined and a Fix is put away, Another side affect is that Crux-1 will forced to be a Single Craft Expedition as Soyuz TMA-19M was going to launch one week after TMA-18M Crash

Chapter  5 - Probes

After for being put on Hold for Years, Solar Probe Alpha Finally Lifts off from CCAFS

Next Launch was MoonRise, A Sample-Return Mission using a Modified Hermes Lander on a Muo V 541

It has a Unique Mission Profile, After Lifting off from the South Pole of the Moon, It will burn to earth into an Aerobraking Trajectory, After Aerobraking, EOI and Circularization, It will pinpoint a Landing Site, De-orbit and Land.

(Note, All the Pictures after this are dark because ksp crashed, but luckily i hit f5)

EOI and TLI was Performed by the Centaur Upper Stage while MOI was Performed by the MoonRise Descent Stage

The Service bay is Packed with fuel for Contengency Situations (Spark Engine wont start etc etc)

Approaching our Landing Site  s l o w l y

"Touchdown Confirmed." At this moment JPL Mission Control erupted in happiness

Launch of the MoonRise Ascent Stage

MOI

TEI (Trans-Earth Injection)

Brake of the Aero (not to be confused with Lithobraking, If you want that go onto the ISRO mission report)

Because I am a Donkey and Forgot to screenshot the EOI, Circularization and De-orbiting. Here is The Sample Return Capsule.

spicy

"Parachute Partially Deployed." Mission Control was Silent and full of Anxiety but then....

"Parachute Deployed, Welcome home Moonrise." MC Erupted knowing that America is back for the Moon, Next Stop, Mars.

 

Thats it for Chapter 5. Next Chapter will include maiden Flight for Koryol as a Boilerplate and A News Report will follow after this....

The Daily Show - 5th of August 2015

As Preparation for Crux 9 and 11 and Altair 1 and 2, Get Ready. NASA Announces the Crew for all Future Crux Missions up to Crux 1

 

 

  • Crux 3 - Danny Cunningham, Patrick Gilbert and Yana Amineva
  • Crux 4 - Pamela Burton, Craig Chapman, Valerie Butle)
  • Crux 5 - Ronald Burton, Craig Fletcher, Kim Garza
  • Crux 6 - Joyce Lucas, Marie Caldwell, Makar Posokhov
  • Crux 7 - Tony Neal, Craig Ray, Mark Jacobs
  • Crux 8 - Leslie Rose, Ronnie Morris, Vadim Elkin
  • Crux 9 - Ralph Cook, Kathryn Hicks, Ronnie Moreno (Apollo 9 Type Mission using Altair 1)
  • Crux 10 - Cindy Carpenter, Ralph Evans, Henry Harris
  • Crux 11 - Lee Banks, Anne Frazier, Henry Ross (First Moon Landing using Altair 2)
  • Crux 12 - Rodney Reed, Makar Galygin, Fred Hanson
  • Crux 13 - Patrick Gilbert, Valerie Butler, Ronnie Morris (Moon Landing)

Chapter 6 - Koryol Flies and JUPO Launches

First Launch of this Report is the NIST (Near Infrared Space Telescope) on the Daleth IV Medium

(Thanks to BDB for giving me this beautiful rocket)

"SECO in 3, 2, 1..."

NIST Launch Fails after a Botched Seperation Event, However this will not interfere with the Launch of JUPO soon on the Daleth IV Heavy, Meanwhile TundraX starts Testing its "Cricket" Test Vehicle

Next was the JUPO Launch (JUpiter Polar Orbiter)

"Liftoff of JUPO headed to Jupiter where it will study it and Its Moons!"

Hydrolox is the GOAT

Booster Sep

JUPO, JUPO has a GRS, Magnometer, RTG and Cameras on it to study Jupiter and its moons

The RL-10 Firing its way to Jupiter

Payload Seperation

Fully Deployed JUPO

Now for the Main Event, Koryol D-1 (Demo-1) launching on the Elbrus Light (No SRBS)

EOI

TLI

moon, Due to an Undiscovered Fault with the Koryol Parachutes (i forgot them), It will now serve as a Moon Satellite to Study Life Support Systems and Radiation Levels.

and thats it!

Chapter 7 - Plans and Crux

With current Studies, NASA is beginning to plan Crewed Mars Missions, The Hercules Mission is Planned for 2031 which will be A Manned Mars Flyby Mission while Ares 1 is due to Launch in 2033

Hercules is due to Launch on the Athena V with an Orion to dock to it for Crew.

The First Launch is Crux-2 to the ISS to Carry the Expedition 47 Crew with the First Orion Female Commander, Anne Frazier who is due to be the First Woman on the Moon on Crux 11

Sadly so we can rendezvous this must be a Night Launch but still I did get some good screenies (PlanetShine is god)

Crux-2 has docked, 14 days later, Crux-1 will undock

Undocking of Crux-1

no more orbit

SM Separation

Re-Entry

"Touchdown of Crux-1"

At ESA, They Reveal their New Mars Lander...... Einstein, Einstein will Launch on an Ariane 5 with Another Mars Orbiter,  ESA's Mars Orbital Demo (MOD)

ESA's MOD below

 

Now for the Private Company Sector....

TundraX

TundraX begins Development on the Millennium 9 v1.0

and Cricket v1.1 Vehicle Gets Scaled Up

Another Private Company also springs up, by the name of Blue Origin......

 

thats it for this chapter

The Lyra Program - Chapter 8: Athena and Bagorah

This will be an Extended Chapter and Will Feature a Few cool Missions

(story time)

In 2008, A Company known as Blue Origin springs up with a goal of Suborbital Tourism using the New Grissom Launch Vehicle, In 2014 they unveiled their plans for an Orbital Launch Vehicle, New Borman which will be a HLV. The Year is now 2015 and New Grissom is ready to launch...

Flight 1 will be unmanned for the sakes of testing, However flight 4 will be crewed,

The also other thing excluded is First Stage Recovery, Flight 2 will be the first attempt at a crewed landing

*insert obligatory planetshine shot*

burn baby burn

After a rough landing, The New Grissom Capsule has landed.

The Next Launch is TundraX's Bagorah 9

Nervous TundraX Eyes watch, If this fails NASA will cut off the contract, luckily Rendezvous wont be on this flight, but the stakes are still high

Liftoff of the Bagorah 9! The Bagorah 9 is only a Test Version of the soon to be Ghidorah 9 which will be fully reusable

planetshine moments

First MVAC Firing

After the Second MVAC Firing, A Vital Software Bug causes it to misfire after Gigan Seperation which caused Severe Damage to the Vehicle, It is believed the recovery system has been destroyed and the RCS Tanks Partially ruptured, The Mission is demanded to be deorbited as per TundraX Policies

The next Launch is done by a Small Australian Company, Eris Space Exploration launching there Sunsis Rocket

However due to Problems with the Flight Computer, FTS is activated and Sunsis Flight 1 is declared a failure.

Now we fast forward onto 2016 and on the Pad is Athena V-Y

The Athena V will be the Main Launch Vehicle for the Altair Lander and Crewed Mars Missions

The Ground violently shakes as the Athena V Takes off, Commander of Future Moon Landing Lee Banks watches, knowing that will take him to the moon

The Payload is a Test Inflatable Module which will be used for the Lunar Orbital Gateway

Athena V-Y is a Success. Meanwhile at the North Pole, They are nearly finishing up on a Mars Simulation run with a Plane coming to collect them

and thats it for Chapter 8!

(Just to note, Crux 3 - 6 were skipped for time problems and screenie problems, it is now 2018 and JUPO2 exists for info)

The Lyra Program - Chapter 9

The Athena V towers the pad once again, Getting ready to launch 2 new ISS Modules, The USHab Module and The iSci Module

This is the first Operational flight of the Athena V after V-Y

EDS

The Modules have been stacked for launch convenience

Docking USHab

Docked iSci

46 Days later is the launch of Crux-7 with Commander Mark Jacobs

 

Crux 7 is docked

Crux-6 Undocking

Crux-6 De-orbiting

Burn time!

I mis-calculated the burn so now we are landing in Australia.

A parachute did not fire but we still landed safely!

 

The Next Launch will be LUCOS 1 (Lunar Communication System), A group of 4 Sats each launch to be put into Lunar Orbit to get ready for Crux 11, It will be launched on a Ghidorah 9 Block 2, It will be the Last Block 2 as Block 3 will attempt reusable.

Overexpansion go brrrrr

A Failure in Staging Makes LUCOS 1 Fail, LUCOS 2 can However fill the void

Thank you for reading chapter 9!

Edited November 25, 2020 by JakGamingKSP

The Lyra Program - Mini-chapter 1: Hermes

The day has come, The Mars Lander, Turms will be launched for the Hermes Sample-return Mission, Turms is the Etruscan equivalent to Hermes, Making it a suitable name for the Lander

"Liftoff of Turms."

"Athena V is nominal", The Launching of Hermes also moved forward the date of the Crewed Mars Landing to 2026 and the Flyby Mission in 2024 with Recent Development, Crew Prospecting has also begun with a Group of Candidates getting picked for The Ares Program,

Stage Seperation Nominal

No EOI Screenies

TMI

(News Segment Below)

"As the Turms Lander leaves for Mars, Hopefully this reminds us that this is in a Greater Step forward, one we took in 1969 when Neil Armstrong walked on the Moon, One we took in 1961 when Yuri Gagarin Orbited the Earth, December 24th 2026, We will launch the next great step."

That announced the Launch date of Ares I

Next Launch is the MASARE Orbiter (Mars Sample Return) on a Muo 541,

The Lyra Program - Chapter 10: Moon or Bust! (p1)

A Ghidorah 9 gets ready to Launch the Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter 2 (LRO2) after LRO1's cameras failed due to an electrical short

Ghidorah 9 Flight 29  Lifts off LC-40. Right after this flight, A TundraX Press Conference has been called due to "Future Plans"

"Systems are Nominal."

EOI.

At the press conference, A new fully reusable Ship was unveiled  by Charles Nussk, Owner of TundraX. Its name was.... Gojira, It had a basic timeline looking like this

  • 2020 - Suborbital Hops
  • 2021 - Cargo Variant Orbit
  • 2022 - Cargo Moon Missions
  • 2022 - Suborbital Crew
  • 2022 - Orbital Crew
  • 2023 - Crewed Moon Orbital Missions
  • 2024 - Cargo Mars Missions
  • 2027 - Crewed Mars Missions

An Artists depiction was also released

40 Minutes after the press conference, Pictures of the moon were received from LRO2 -

Meanwhile, ETS attempts to Launch 6 Cubesats in LEO using their new Photon Rocket and Recover the First Stage, CEO Parker Deck proceeds to eat a hat Before Launch

 

 

If you look very carefully, you can see the chutes

Next Launch is Crux 8,

 

Next Chapter is Crux 9, 10 and 11

 

 

 

 

Edited November 28, 2020 by JakGamingKSP

The Lyra Program - Chapter 11: Moon or Bust! (p2)

As the date to Crux-9 came closer, Tests of the Gojira began, Shortly after the announcement, Hopper1 went up 140m and before Crux 9, GN8 launches to 12km

"GN8 has landed, Congrats to the team at TundraX, Next Stop 80km"

Now Altair 1 is on the pad, Ready to perform an apollo 10 Like mission

Now Crux-9 Launches

Altair 1 begins its descent to a simulated abort situation, at 6km CDR Ralph Cook and PLT Kathryn Hicks will trigger the abort motor and lift back to the orion.

Altair 1 soon loses contact with Houston for an unknown reason, 48hrs later the Crew of Altair 1 is presumed dead.

An inquiry reveals that Ralph Cook accidentally programmed the system wrong which would've triggered the abort motor before impact. due to the Accident being caused by a Human error, not Hardware or Software error, All other altair missions are still on schedule.

MIS Henry Harris begins his journey back to Earth, but he refuses...

 

"Henry, You have a girlfriend and you are only 28. Don't through your life away."

"When I was assigned to this mission, I took an oath. If Hicks and Cook died. I wouldn't return and that's final"

Henry Ceases transmissions and de-orbits the Crux. Henry is celebrated as an Astronauts' hero and dies a martyr of some sort.

 

 

 

Rest in Peace the crew of Crux-9.

You served valiantly and proud.

 

(2022-2030 will be apart of a different MR, "The Age of Exploration")
Congrats on successfully landing your little Starship!

6 hours ago, KerballingSmasher said:

Congrats on successfully landing your little Starship!

after about 167 tries, thanks!

The Lyra Program - Minichapter 2: Hermes and something else

For all effective purposes, I skipped crux 10 to get to the cool stuff.

The MLAV Begins its EDL Process

Mission Control is full of anxiety

"Turms has Landed"

Now we have MASARE Orbital Insertion

Now after Crux 10 (which i forgot to screenshot), comes the De-orbiting of Crux 8

Re-entry

 

Thanks for reading, Its just to give you guys some content, Chapter 12 will be on 26/12/20 (AEDT)
